title: What is the concept of animal magnetism and its relevance in modern medicine?
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens of this text, Dr. A. Espinouse traces the discovery of the laws and principles underlying animal magnetism and its effects on human beings. He argues that all the forces of nature, from magnetism to electricity, are different modifications of the same fundamental principle. As he examines a medical case related to an abdominal abscess, he touches on the use of somnambulistic magnetism and its benefits in medicine. The text concludes with a defense of magnetism and a call to embrace the scientific potential of this phenomenon despite the opposition of skeptics.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the misuse of tobacco has a harmful effect on the brain, and many intellectuals who have made significant contributions to society avoided smoking. As for the usage of hypnosis or suggestion, while there are both charlatans and genuine cases, it is best to approach such experiences with caution and skepticism. While science may not verify all such phenomena, it also cannot rule out their possibility. Therefore, it is important to be conscientious and impartial in evaluating such practices.
